title: N.O.A.A CCES
description: In 2018, the National Oceanic Atmospheric Association (N.O.A.A) conducted the California Current Ecosystem Survey (C.C.E.S). They attached microphones to drifting buoys and set them in the California currrent. The buoys recorded 2 minutes of sound at a time. From these recordings, reseachers computed various metrics such as Third Octave Levels and the Broadband measurement. They also searched the data for beaked and sperm whale sounds.

title: Cetacean Density
description: Becker et. al (2020) estimated the density of cetaceans in the California Current Ecosystem using survey data from 1991-2018. The density is measured in animals per square kilometer.

title: Sea Lion Density
description: Welch and Hazen et. al. (2019) generated a density map of Sea Lions in the California Current Ecosystem using Boosted Regression Tree Models.

title: Shipping Density
description: N.O.A.A and B.O.E.M maintain a dataset of vessel traffic data, also known as Automatic Identification System (AIS) data. The shipping density is measured by counting the number of unique ships passing through 0.1 latitude by 0.1 longitude square over the course of the month.

title: Oil and Natural Gas Platforms
description: The Department of Homeland Security maintains a dataset of Oil and Natural Gas platforms off the coast of the United States.
